page.title: 11A Mixed Farm
page.content: La Maitrerie is a typical Jersey Farm. It covers 44 vergees (20 acres); with a further 3O v'gees (13 acres) rented. 45 head of Jersey cattle are kept and cabbage, cauliflowers, potatoes and kale are grown. Land is also used for grazing and hay-making. Fields are rotated so that soil does not become exhausted and after a while each field is given over to grass to allow it to rest. Fertilizers, lime and manure are also used. The cows' milk is sold to the Dairy and most of the crops grown exported to the U.K. 2 people work on the farm all the year but 4-5 people are employed at busy times. The machinery used includes milking machines, tractors, sprayer, potato harvester, ploughs, trailers and bulk milk storage tank. The herd of cattle and the crop growing are equally important on this mixed farm.
